data.title: Departments – Welcome to San Bernardino County
data.meta_description: Departments Below is a list of County Departments and their main services. Use the search capability to find information using keywords, if necessary.
data.text: Preschool Services 888.543.7025 Head Start, Early Head Start, Child Care Partnership (CCP), California State Preschool (CSPP), Low-Income First Time Mothers (LIFT), Prevention and Early Intervention (PEI), Home Visitation (HVP) & Fatherhood FIRE. Museum 909.798.8608 San Bernardino County Museum, Redlands, Victor Valley Museum, Apple Valley, Regional, Collections, Natural History, Cultural History, Exhibits, Hands-on, Student, Family, Children, Rental, Loan kit, Fieldtrip, Visit, Research, Volunteer, Internship, Events, Weddings, Anthropology, Biology, Paleontology, Geology, History, Science, Native, Indigenous, Museum Store Library 909.387.2220 Digital Library, Online Database, Book Search, Veteran Resources, Get a Library Card Legislative Affairs 909.387.4821 Advocate the County’s interest on the federal, state and local level. Land Use Services 909.387.8311 Building Permits, Plan Check, Inspections, Community Clean ups, Off Highway vehicles Program, Graffiti Removal, Cannabis Enforcement/Abatement, Vehicle Abatement, Special Use Permits and Select Business Licensees, Code Enforcement, Fire Hazard Abatement, Zoning, Use, and Development Standards, Land Use Entitlements, Planning Document Library, Mining, Roads and Drainage, Short-term rentals, Home Occupation Permit. Innovation and Technology Department 909.388.5500 Enterprise information technologies, cloud computing, information security, telecommunications, public safety radio, application development services, IT business continuity management, productivity platform solutions. In-Home Supportive Services Public Authority 866.985.6322 Training, Homecare Inland Counties Emergency Medical Agency 909.388.5823 Local Emergency Medical Agency (LEMSA) and San Bernardino County lead agency overseeing Emergency Medical Services (EMS) system. EMS Certifications and Licenses. Documentation/Data Collection and Evaluation. System Organization and Management. Medical Disaster Preparedness and Response. Ambulance Transportation. Assessment of Hospitals and Critical Care Centers. Human Resources 909.387.8304 Benefits, Center for Employee Health and Wellness (CEHW), Classification, Compliance and Ethics, Employee Relations, Employee Resources, Employment, hiring, Wellness, training, Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO), and Labor Relations. Building and Safety 909.387.8311 Review Construction Plans, Permit Issuance, Inspect Construction Work, Final Inspections. Board of Supervisors – 5th District 909.387.4565 Serves San Bernardino, Rialto, Colton, and the unincorporated areas of Bloomington, Muscoy, Rosena Ranch, Arrowhead Farms, Little 3rd, El Rancho Verde, and Devore. First 5 909.386.7706 Resources for children through the age of five. Board of Supervisors – 4th District 909.465.5265 Serves Chino, Chino Hills, Ontario, Montclair, and Upland. Environmental Health Services 800.442.2283 Body art, charitable feeding operations, cottage food operations, food facilities, health education, housing and camps, land use, massage clinics, medical waste, mosquito and vector control, plan check, public swimming pools, safe drinking water, solid waste, wastewater, wholesale food Board of Supervisors – 3rd District 909.387.4855 Serves Grand Terrace, Loma Linda, Redlands, Highland, Yucaipa, Big Bear Lake, Lake Arrowhead, and Crestline. Economic Development Agency 909.387.4700 Manufacturing, Opportunity Zones, Retail, Film Permitting, Travel and Tourism Board of Supervisors – 2nd District 909.387.4833 Serves Upland, Rancho Cucamonga, Fontana and Mt. Baldy. Probation 909.387.5874 Administration, Adult Probation, Adult Day Reporting Centers, Adult Programs & Services, ARISE Program, Domestic Violence classes, Drug & Alcohol classes, Juvenile Day Reporting Centers, Juvenile Detention & Assessment Center (Juvenile Hall), Juvenile Intervention Programs & Services, Juvenile Justice & Delinquency Prevention, Juvenile Probation, Mental Health Services, Probation Supervision, Probation Violations, Reentry Services, Treatment Services, Victim’s Resources, Warrants, Youth Programs & Services. District Attorney 909.382.3800 Criminal Prosecutions, Victim and Witness Services, Officer-Involved Shooting Response Team Project and Facilities Management 909.387.5000 Planning / Design / Construction / Building Maintenance / Landscaping / Custodial / Fire/Life Safety. County Fire 909.387.5974 Fire, Rescue, EMS, Training, Community Risk Reduction, Investigation, Household Hazardous Waste, Hazmat- CUPA. Public Authority 866.985.6322 San Bernardino County Public Authority brings together IHSS consumers and workers in partnership to foster the development of high-quality personal assistance services. The governing body of the Public Authority serves as a meeting ground for consumers, workers, and representatives of city government. Public Defender 909.382.3965 Clear Your Record, Community Outreach, Criminal Defense, Defense Attorney, Expungement, Holistic Defense, Indigent Defense, Juvenile Defense, Juvenile Delinquency, Legal Assistance, Post-Conviction Relief, Public Defender, Record Clearing Board of Supervisors – 1st District 760.995.8100 Serves the High Desert, including the Cities of Hesperia, Victorville, and Apple Valley. County Counsel 909.387.5455 Represents the County in litigation. Public Health 800.782.4264 Animal Care, California Children’s Services, Clinic Operations, Communicable Disease, Environmental Health Services (EHS), Family Health Services, Health Education, Community Outreach & Education, HIV/AIDS Services, Public Health Laboratory, Nutrition and Wellness Services, Preparedness & Response, Vital Statistics Registration Office, Women, Infants & Children (WIC) County Administrative Office 888.818.8988 County Administration and Management, County Operations, Legislative Affairs, Government Relations, Public Information Behavioral Health 888.743.1478 24-Hour Helplines, Addiction, Alcohol and Drug, Mental Health, Behavioral Health, Centralized Children’s Intensive Case Management Services, Community Outreach Services, Crisis and Urgent Care, Drug Medi-Cal, Youth Services, Forensic Services, Homeless, Intensive Care Coordination, Mental Health Services Act, Outpatient Clinics, Prevention and Early Intervention, Referral, Screening, Assessment and Treatment, Substance Abuse Prevention & Treatment Public Works 909.387.7910 Transportation, Flood Control, Solid Waste, Surveyor, Special Districts, permits, inspections, planning, maps, roads, paving, traffic, snow removal, water and sanitation, zoo, parks, landfills, organic waste recycling, environmental planning and maintenance, stormwater, contracts, project proposals, and public notices. Auditor-Controller/Treasurer/Tax Collector (ATC) 909.387.8322 Accounting for Internal Service Funds, Accounts Payable, Cash Flow Projections, Central Payroll, Disaster Accounting, Employment Verification, Enterprise Resource Planning Software SAP, Fraud, Waste, and Abuse Hotline, GANN Appropriations Limit Calculations, General Obligation Bonds, Operational and Compliance Audits, Property Tax Bills, Property Tax Rates, Property Tax Refunds, Revenue Recovery and Debt Collection, Tax Sales, Treasury Pool, Wage Garnishments Community Revitalization 909.387.7417 Administrative support to the department of Community Development & Housing and Office of Homeless Services Homeless Services 909.501.0610 The Office of Homeless Services serves as the Lead Agency and/or Administrative Entity for various grant funds and the San Bernardino County Homeless Partnership. OHS supports the San Bernardino County Homeless Partnership in its mission to reduce homelessness within the county by ensuring individuals at risk of homelessness or experiencing homelessness are connected to housing, supportive services, and case management. Purchasing 909.387.2060 The Purchasing Department offers procurement services, monitors policy compliance, administers countywide contracts, manages vendor relationships, oversees the procurement card program, and establishes electronic procurement system functionality. In addition to procurement, the Purchasing Department offers mail and courier services, liquidation of surplus property, recycling programs and storage services. Assessor-Recorder-Clerk (ARC) 909.387.8307 Birth, Death and Marriage Certificates, Marriage License and Ceremony, Public Records, Property Information, Fictitious Business Names, Document Recording, Change of Address Requests. Real Estate Services 909.387.5000 Real Property portfolio and lease management, Contract negotiation and execution, Project Management, Acquisition and Disposition, Right of Way, Land use/development/ground leases, Joint powers agreements, License agreements, Special use agreements, Market analysis, Pro forma analysis, Real Estate Strategy. Community Development and Housing 909.387.4700 Community Development and Housing manages a wide variety of grant funded construction, public service, and revitalization projects, and provides community and housing development resources for low- and moderate-income families, individuals, and communities. Arrowhead Regional Medical Center (ARMC) 877.873.2762 Full service acute-care, university-affiliated medical center and level 1 trauma center, comprehensive stroke center and regional burn center. Full complement of inpatient and outpatient clinical services to include (but not limited to) primary and specialty care, maternity services, pediatrics, orthopedics, cardiac/cardiac surgery, neurology/neurosurgery, mobile clinic services and more. Fleet Management 909.387.7870 Vehicles, equipment, and services for County departments. Vehicle Misuse Form. Regional Parks 909.387.2757 Camping, hiking, fishing, biking, equestrian, off-highway vehicles, archery and shooting ranges, golf, disc golf. Code Enforcement 909.884.4056 760.995.8140 File a Complaint, Apply for Permits, Administrative Citation Information, Cannabis Enforcement Program, Short-Term Rental Information. Animal Care 800.472.5609 Pet Adoptions, Lost & Found Pets, Dog Licensing, Spay/Neuter Resources, Field Service Request, Wildlife, Rescue Partner Information Registrar of Voters 909.387.8300 Register to vote, change voter information, voting sites, military and overseas voting, polling place and voter information guide look-up tool, voter information guide, My Elections Gateway, current elections, campaign finance disclosures. Clerk of the Board of Supervisors 909.387.3841 Board agendas, filing and hearing of appeals of assessed property valuations, filing of conflict of interest documents, filing of environmental documents. Finance and Administration 909.387.5423 Finance and Administration is responsible for the preparation and administration of the County budget, including development of the five-year forecast and annual strategic plan; the administration and monitoring of the County general fund long-term debt portfolio, which includes both issuance and post-issuance activities; and oversight and administration of the County’s capital improvement program. Airports 909.387.8810 High-quality aviation facilities and services. Risk Management 909.386.8655 Liability claims, risk control, training and materials, ADA access. Children’s Network 909.383.9677 Child abuse prevention, campaigns include: Adverse Childhood Experiences, Burns, Domestic Violence Father Engagement, Infant Safe Sleep, Maternal Mental Health, Public Service Announcements and Shaken Baby. Agriculture Commissioner/Sealer of Weights & Measures 909.387.2105 Crop reports, Farmer’s Market Locations, Consumer Protection Weights and Measures, Pest Prevention, Environmental Protection, Agricultural Permits. Sheriff/Coroner 909.884.0156 909.387.2978 Crime Prevention, CleanSWEEP, Crime Mapping, CCW, H.O.P.E., Juvenile Intervention Program, Safe Return Program. Children and Family Services (CFS) 800.827.8724 Adoption and fostering services for children. Aging and Adult Services 877.565.2020 Adult Protective Services, Age Wise, Family Caregiver Support, In-Home Support, Health Insurance Counseling Nutrition, Senior Information. Transitional Assistance 909.388.0245 CalWORKs, CalFresh, Medi-Cal, Welfare-to-Work, Child Care, Foster Care, Cash Aid Program for Immigrants, General Relief, Nutrition, EBT, Health Coverage, Cash Benefits, Financial Assistance, Employment. Child Support 866.901.3212 Establish legal paternity, open a case, make payments.
